snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has signed a bill allowing the city to use lever machines for the mayoral primary election and the runoff that is expected to follow.
abstract: New York City Board of Elections votes unanimously to use lever voting machines for mayoral primary election and runoff that is expected to follow; action comes one day after Gov Andrew M Cuomo signed legislation that authorized return of the machines, which had been replaced in 2010 by more modern electronic voting devices
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has signed a bill allowing the city to use lever machines for the mayoral primary election and the runoff that is expected to follow.

headline.main: Lever Voting Machines and New Runoff Date Are Approved by Cuomo
headline.print_headline: Board Votes To Reinstate Old Machines For Primary
